citeinfo.title: Cold Springs::COBLX::000457
citeinfo.othercit: The Fire Incident Mapping Tools (FIMT) is an ArcGIS extension designed to store, edit, display, and print wildland fire data.

descript.abstract: This is a data set to represent the existing condition of a fire incident at the time data edit.
descript.purpose: The purpose of the data is to create maps so the fire overhead team can make good decisions and to show the field going personnel where all aspects of the fire are located and where in relation to their proximity are all other fire and fire suppression resources located.
descript.supplinf: This data was produced using the Fire Incident Mapping Tools (FIMT) ArcGIS extension version 9.2.1.6.

bounding.westbc: REQUIRED: Western-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.
bounding.eastbc: REQUIRED: Eastern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.
bounding.northbc: REQUIRED: Northern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.
bounding.southbc: REQUIRED: Southern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.

idinfo.accconst: There are no access constraints known on this data.
idinfo.useconst: There are no known use constraints on the data. Just beware that this data is gathered and produced in a method that is to meet time deadlines. Some of the data is not very accurate. Please check the accuracy values first (realizing that much of the time, these values are not provided or entered).
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

attracc.attraccr: This data is produced to give fire suppression resources ability to generally see where the fire and suppression resources are located. They do not have to be all that accurate. Please review the feature level metadata to see if the quality of the data is complete.

dataqual.logic: This data is produced to give fire suppression resources ability to generally see where the fire and suppression resources are located. They do not have to be all that accurate. Please review the feature level metadata to see if the quality of the data is complete.
dataqual.complete: This data is as complete as could logically be obtained to meet publishing deadlines for the day.

horizpa.horizpar: This data is produced to give fire suppression resources ability to generally see where the fire and suppression resources are located. They do not have to be all that accurate. Please review the feature level metadata to see if the quality of the data is complete.

srcinfo.srccontr: Please review the feature level metadata to see if the quality of the data is complete.

procstep.procdesc:
Most of the data is heads up digitized on the screen or is pulled in from other layers. The FIMT extension maintains coincidence between the Fire Polygon, Fire Perimeter, and the Assignment Breaks.
For more information on Fire Incident Mapping Tools (FIMT), please go to http://gis.nwcg.gov/ website and then choose the Tools menu option. There will be links there to the release letter, software installation file, user's guide, tutorial, and other useful information.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

cntinfo.cntinst: Check with the local land manager to get a copy of the data.

distinfo.techpreq: It would greatly help to review the data using the Fire Incident Mapping Tools software, but it would not be required. The software is almost completely used to assist in standardizing the data structure and how the data is incorporated into the personal geodatabase.

cntaddr.addrtype: REQUIRED: The mailing and/or physical address for the organization or individual.
cntaddr.city: REQUIRED: The city of the address.
cntaddr.state: REQUIRED: The state or province of the address.
cntaddr.postal: REQUIRED: The ZIP or other postal code of the address.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
metainfo.metuc: The data was generated to a broad resource standard. Data within will have differing levels of metadata. Primary use of the data is to meet emergency need and getting metadata on any and all features are pretty low on the priority list. Please review the metadata fields to determine if there would be of any use on the constraints of the use of this data.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.2.3552
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The purpose of the data is to create maps so the fire overhead team can make good decisions and to show the field going personnel where all aspects of the fire are located and where in relation to their proximity are all other fire and fire suppression resources located.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: This is a data set to represent the existing condition of a fire incident at the time data edit.

Please check the accuracy values first (realizing that much of the time, these values are not provided or entered).
